degday 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Compute degree days

Source: R/dd_vals.R
dd_vals.Rd

Compute degree days from daily min and max temperature

dd_vals(
  daily_min,
  daily_max,
  nextday_min = NULL,
  thresh_low = NULL,
  thresh_up = NULL,
  method = c("sng_tri", "dbl_tri", "sng_sine", "dbl_sine", "simp_avg")[0],
  cutoff = c("horizontal", "vertical")[1],
  cumulative = FALSE,
  noneg = TRUE,
  debug = FALSE
)

dd_sng_tri(
  daily_min,
  daily_max,
  thresh_low = NULL,
  thresh_up = NULL,
  cumulative = FALSE
)

dd_sng_sine(
  daily_min,
  daily_max,
  thresh_low = NULL,
  thresh_up = NULL,
  cumulative = FALSE
)

dd_dbl_tri(
  daily_min,
  daily_max,
  nextday_min = NULL,
  thresh_low = NULL,
  thresh_up = NULL,
  cumulative = FALSE
)

dd_dbl_sine(
  daily_min,
  daily_max,
  nextday_min = NULL,
  thresh_low = NULL,
  thresh_up = NULL,
  cumulative = FALSE
)

Arguments

daily_min

The daily minimum temperature
daily_max

The daily maximum temperature
nextday_min

The minimum temp the day after
thresh_low

The lower development threshold
thresh_up

The upper development threshold
method

The method used
cutoff

The cutoff method
cumulative

Return cumulative values
noneg

Set negative values to zero
debug

Show additional messages

Details

Units for daily_min, daily_max, thresh_low, and thresh_up should all be the same (i.e., all Fahrenheit or all Celsius). The function does not check for unit consistency.

nextday_min is required for the double-triangle and the double-sine methods. These methods use the minimum temperature of the following day to model temperatures in the 2nd half of thd day.

noneg = TRUE sets negative values to zero. This is generally accepted when using degree days to predict the timing of development milestones, if one assumes that growth can not go backwards.

Functions

  • dd_sng_tri: Compute degree days using the single-triangle method

  • dd_sng_sine: Compute degree days using the single-sine method

  • dd_dbl_tri: Compute degree days using the double-triangle method

  • dd_dbl_sine: Compute degree days using the double-sine method
